pageTitle: Bristol City - City Take Spence On Loan From WHU
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {12044=Elliott Joins City's Coaching Staff (Tuesday June 9 2015), 12663=Bristol City Fixtures 2015/16 (Thursday June 18 2015), 13511=Agard To Start Season On Sideline (Thursday July 2 2015), 13304=Goalkeeper Speculation Starts With Bunn (Monday June 29 2015), 13091=No Offers For Freeman Or Any Other Players (Monday June 29 2015), 11835=Win Tickets To N5L With Vital Football (Friday June 5 2015), 13719=The Supporters Summit - Bristol City (Friday July 3 2015), 12463=Burton Albion Show An Interest In JET (Friday June 12 2015), 18719=Date:Saturday March 5 2011, 18673=Time: 2:25PM, 22414=Bristol City manager Keith Millen has taken young West Ham United defender Jordan Spence on loan. The 20-year-old right-back is expected to make his debut today at Coventry, he has been brought in on a 28 day loan initially, but it is expected he will stay until the end of the current season. Millen had already failed to land the player in January, but now the Hammers have had a change of mind. Millen said: 'We've been aware of Jordan for some time and he is a player we looked at in January. He is a right-back who can play centre-half, is a good athlete and has been close to the first-team squad at West Ham for a while now. 'The injury to Louis Carey left us short and Jordan will be a good addition to the squad. He trained with the rest of the squad on Thursday and will be in the squad at Coventry. 'He's played a lot of games for West Ham reserves as captain this season, was involved in a game against Arsenal on Tuesday night, and is match- fit. You need to be match-fit in the Championship, or you will be found out.', 12252=Joe Bryan Signs Contract Extension. (Tuesday June 9 2015), 12876=Pemberton Tips City To Do Well Next Term (Monday June 22 2015)}
